name: Content Producer
desct: Content ProducerCloudFactory.Kathmandu, Bāgmatī, NepalApply NowContent ProducerCloudFactory.Kathmandu, Bāgmatī, Nepal21 hours agoBe among the first 25 applicantsSee who CloudFactory. has hired for this roleApply NowSaveSave jobSave this job with your existing LinkedIn profile, or create a new one.Your job seeking activity is only visible to you.EmailContinueWelcome backSign in to saveContent ProduceratCloudFactory..Email or phonePasswordShowForgot password?Sign inReport this jobDescriptionAt CloudFactory, we like to think of ourselves as a mission with a company. Our dream is to connect one million people in the developing world to digital-age work while raising them up as leaders to address poverty in their own communities. We believe the new CloudFactory Academy is the key to doing just that, and we’re looking for exceptional Content Producers to join our team and help produce various types of world-class leadership and learning development content.This role requires a passion for visual storytelling, a high level of creativity, a solid understanding of the tools that bring a creative vision to life, attention to detail, and the ability to think and work independently at times. It might look like assisting with scripting out a new video one day, living life behind the camera the next day, diving into post-production later in the week, and polishing the week off by helping with the design of our latest digital curriculum. In short, if you love all things creative and want to bring static messages to life in a way that moves people, this is the role for you.The RoleSeeking a visual artist at heart with the technical expertise of video production, which is great because that’s the bulk of what you’ll be doing with the CloudFactory Academy team. You are just as talented behind the lens and love life with a camera that can ‘run and gun’ with the best of them, capturing fantastic stories at any sort of event. But you’re also not afraid to direct a planned production. And when production is wrapped, you’re just getting started. You love diving into all forms of post-production, including editing, colour grading, sound engineering, and everything in between!But you know there’s more to the visual artist than just video. You can dabble in graphic design and love to tinker around with all sorts of visual mediums. You can make a gif or create a stellar HDR photo, and if you don’t know how to do something you know how to find the answers. To save time, you know the value in customizing templates that are already out there.Ultimately, you are a great content creator but want a challenge to help you grow. And that’s exactly what CloudFactory wants to do as well. We want to bring someone alongside us and give you the tools and time to shine. We know we are not where we want to be with the quality or quantity of what we can produce, and you are going to help turn that around!Key ObjectivesRegularly participate in and contribute to the conceptualization of creative content, working closely with the CloudFactory Academy team to take vague needs and turn them into concrete production plans.Assist and/or lead the production of videos for the CloudFactory Academy, internal communications, and potentially external audiences. Video production and the various tasks involved in it will account for over 50% of the job.Design and create curriculum materials through Adobe CC (InDesign, Illustrator, Photoshop, etc.) and Google Slides within the brand standards.As a Content Producer, you might also assist with the identification, production, and publication of Impact Stories through VLOGS and BLOGS. You’ll work with content creators within the Engagement Team to find our interesting stories (there are a lot of them), tell them in a compelling way, and share it with the company.Assist in the maintenance and updating of an active content production schedule.Potentially collaborate with external designers and content creators when needed.Assist on other CloudFactory creative content projects as needed.Requirements5+ years of Video Production Experience with a portfolio to demonstrate what you have produced (YouTube, Vimeo, or shared links) and a vision of what you want to one day be able to produce. Make no mistake, this is not an entry-level role and your video production abilities will be tested.3+ years of Graphic Design & Content Production Experience or a demonstrated expert abilitiesAgain, a recent portfolio of compelling work and an established track record in creating visually stunning content. This is a must.Demonstrated proficiency in Adobe CC & Google SuiteDemonstrated proficiency in camera operation, video production, and photographyExperience in agile project management a plusExperience in Design Thinking a plusExperience in UI/UX design a plusBA/BS in Graphic Design, journalism, Video Production, or equivalent work experience.BenefitsGreat Mission and CultureMeaningful WorkGrowth OpportunitiesMarket Competitive SalaryHealth and Medical BenefitsAbout CloudFactoryCloudFactory provides a tech-forward, professionally managed workforce solution with all the benefits of a trained internal team. Our teams are agile, scale fast, and process data with high accuracy on virtually any platform specializing in Digitization, Managed Crowd-sourcing, Image Annotation, Image Labeling, Cloud Labor, Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, Natural Language Processing, Video Labeling, Video Annotation, Outsourcing, Data Processing, Data Labeling, and Workforce SolutionsCloudFactory is on a mission to change how work gets done. We're using technology to make it super easy and affordable for startups and fast-growing companies to automate and outsource routine back-office data work. As a leader in the Impact Sourcing movement, we aim to connect 1 million people to online work, while raising them up as leaders to address poverty in their own communities. Our workforce is recruited from talent “hot spots” around the globe such as Nepal and Kenya where we can hire the best and brightest in areas where there are thousands of talented people, but limited opportunities for meaningful and sustainable employment.Show moreShow lessSeniority levelAssociateEmployment typeFull-timeJob functionMarketingPublic RelationsWriting/EditingIndustriesInformation Technology and ServicesComputer SoftwareInternetReferrals increase your chances of interviewing at CloudFactory. by 2xSee who you knowTurn on job alertsContent Producer in Kathmandu, Bāgmatī, NepalOnOff

name: Technical Director, CSM, Nepal
desct: Technical Director, CSM, NepalFHI 360Kathmandu, Bāgmatī, NepalApply on company websiteTechnical Director, CSM, NepalFHI 360Kathmandu, Bāgmatī, Nepal20 hours agoBe among the first 25 applicantsSee who FHI 360 has hired for this roleApply on company websiteSaveSave jobSave this job with your existing LinkedIn profile, or create a new one.Your job seeking activity is only visible to you.EmailContinueWelcome backSign in to saveTechnical Director, CSM, NepalatFHI 360.Email or phonePasswordShowForgot password?Sign inReport this jobTechnical DirectorCivil Society and Media Project (CSM), NepalFHI 360, an international non-governmental organization (NGO), is recruiting a highly qualified and dynamic candidate for the expected United States Agency for International Development (USAID)-funded Civil Society and Media Project (CSM) in Nepal as Technical Director. The Technical Director will provide GESI-related guidance to CSM as part of the Senior Management Team (90%), while also providing technical assistance to other civil society projects in the Asia Pacific region (approximately 10%).Position DescriptionThe Senior Management Team for CSM-Nepal consists of the Chief of Party, the Deputy Chief of Party, the Technical Director, and the Director of Finance and Administration. The Technical Director position will also report to the Asia Pacific Regional Office on an as-needed basis when technical assistance is required on other projects. This arrangement ensures that CSM benefits from strong technical support in Nepal and can benefit from lessons learned from other FHI 360 projects in the region. This also provides an opportunity for CSM to share its experience more widely through networks of experts in FHI 360 and beyond.Within the CSM project, the central role of the Technical Director is to ensure a sustained focus on GESI-related issues both with regard to patterns of civic engagement, sustainable leadership processes and in assessing and supporting related law, policy and public service practice. The Technical Director will oversee cross-cutting technical activities that increase the capacity of civil society and media to engage with government at all levels, promote local government accountability and decreased tolerance for corruption, and advocate for policies that address inequality and support inclusive democratic participation. The Technical Director will be responsible for providing technical leadership to design activities that increase the participation of women, ethnic minorities, and other marginalized groups. The Technical Director will support CSO efforts to be more inclusive and promote the leadership of women and minorities in public life. She/he will lead a team that improves the organizational capacity of CSOs to operate more effectively and improve their reputational standing in the communities where they work. The Technical Director will also oversee the project’s monitoring and evaluation and legal analysis team. Availability of position is contingent upon award to FHI 360.Key ResponsibilitiesAssist the COP and DCOP with strategic and operational planning, including work planningLead development of cross-cutting strategies to incorporate gender and social inclusion (GESI) in CSM activitiesSupport partner CSOs to improve GESI integration into the organizations’ mission and activitiesOversee design of technical activities in civil society capacity building and monitoring evaluationOversee staff and partners that legal analysis and policy review for CSM activitiesConduct performance assessments of direct supervisees, identifying and recommending areas for improvement and opportunities for professional developmentMentor and manage staff in a respectful and transparent manner, working with local staff to build their technical and administrative capacityQualificationsAt least 8-10 years senior level experience in civil society, governance, organizational capacity building, advocacy, rule of law, or other related democracy, rights, and governance sectors;At least five years of experience in gender and social inclusion;Demonstrated ability to think strategically and navigate politically sensitive terrain;Familiarity with USAID programming, including rules and regulations required;Professional proficiency in English required, including excellent written communication skills;Experience building CSO capacity;Experience with designing and drafting CSO related legislation; andKnowledge of the Nepal legal context, especially related to civil society.This job posting summarizes the main duties of the job. It neither prescribes nor restricts the exact tasks that may be assigned to carry out these duties. This document should not be construed in any way to represent a contract of employment. Management reserves the right to review and revise this document at any time.FHI 360 is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer whereby we do not engage in practices that discriminate against any person employed or seeking employment based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national or ethnic origin, age, marital status, physical or mental disability, protected Veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under applicable law.FHI 360 fosters the strength and health of its workforce through a competitive benefits package , professional development and policies and programs that support a healthy work/life balance. name: Delivery Project Lead
desct: Delivery Project LeadCloudFactory.Kathmandu, Bāgmatī, NepalApply NowDelivery Project LeadCloudFactory.Kathmandu, Bāgmatī, Nepal2 weeks agoBe among the first 25 applicantsSee who CloudFactory. has hired for this roleApply NowSaveSave jobSave this job with your existing LinkedIn profile, or create a new one.Your job seeking activity is only visible to you.EmailContinueWelcome backSign in to saveDelivery Project LeadatCloudFactory..Email or phonePasswordShowForgot password?Sign inReport this jobDescriptionYou, as a Delivery Project Lead with CloudFactory, will be the leader and mentor to some extremely talented Project Delivery teams. CloudFactory’s Delivery Leads are the bridge between two sets of clients: customers, who are the source of the data work, and cloud workers, who get the work done. They guide the conversations between the two clients to make sure there is alignment across the board on the work we’re streaming. Pods [our project delivery teams] are responsible for the ongoing delivery of data and AI projects. Your role as a Delivery Project Lead is firstly a mentorship role, you’ll be teaching your team the ropes, hopping on client calls and coaching them to be the most successful project managers on the market. The hope is that they will eventually be better at project management than you.CloudFactory is a ten year old mission-driven startup that aims to be the AWS of Cloud Labor. We use a combination of the latest technology and an on-demand, global workforce to enable scalable, efficient, and high quality digital data work. It is our ambitious social mission and deep ties on the ground in Asia and Africa that drive us to innovate and change how companies get work done.The FitRequirementsThis isn’t your typical project management position. You thrive in a high-growth, dynamic, fast-paced entrepreneurial environment, which means things can change quickly (don’t say we didn’t warn you). This position requires a balance between people and delivery project management - primarily coaching people to manage projects better so that we wow our clients and workers. So a customer-focused individual who is passionate about people and technology is the #1 quality we’re looking for.You love building relationships, are passionate about people and can manage through ups-and-downs. You can manage multiple large and high revenue projects and/or scenarios simultaneously. Being close to the customers and the workers will require getting your hands dirty from time-to-time. You need to be able to understand the work we do, how we do it, and why we do it. That usually requires doing it yourself, first. Fitting with us requires the ability to be flexible with working times as most of our clients are in the US, Australia and Europe.You are a great communicator. You have impeccable communication skills and are an excellent all-around communicator — verbal, written, and interpersonal. You’ve also got a high EQ (emotional intelligence). You’ll need to empathize with our customers and work cross-culturally with team members across the globe.You're confident, but humble. You're adventurous, you do not refrain from experimentation. You're data-driven. You're a natural problem solver. And you are resourceful.Don't worry if you don't tick all the boxes. At CloudFactory, we're very intentional about our culture, so above all we're looking for open-minded individuals to learn and grow together with.The ExperienceThe experience required to work with us is at least 4+ years doing western-style client communication and experience in dealing with large projects. You have experience working with highly capable and driven individuals, and have the drive and intellect to handle tough situations. Project Management, general management and experience in a high-growth tech company are a plus. Technical experience, although not a must, would be another big plus. A hunger for learning about AI or courses related to AI - you guessed it - another plus!BenefitsLunch & Snacks Provided Monday-FridayPhone Allowance and/or Internet AllowanceTravel AllowanceSocial Security FundFestival BonusHealth Spending AccountMedical InsuranceAccidental InsuranceAmazing Company Mission and CultureGrowth OpportunitiesShow moreShow lessSeniority levelAssociateEmployment typeFull-timeJob functionOtherIndustriesInformation Technology and ServicesComputer SoftwareInternetReferrals increase your chances of interviewing at CloudFactory. by 2xSee who you knowTurn on job alertsDelivery Lead in Kathmandu, Bāgmatī, NepalOnOff

Our dream is to connect one million people in the developing world to digital-age work while raising them up as leaders to address poverty in their own communities. It might look like assisting with scripting out a new video one day, living life behind the camera the next day, diving into post-production later in the week, and polishing the week off by helping with the design of our latest digital curriculum. In short, if you love all things creative and want to bring static messages to life in a way that moves people, this is the role for you.The RoleSeeking a visual artist at heart with the technical expertise of video production, which is great because that’s the bulk of what you’ll be doing with the CloudFactory Academy team. You are just as talented behind the lens and love life with a camera that can ‘run and gun’ with the best of them, capturing fantastic stories at any sort of event. But you’re also not afraid to direct a planned production. And when production is wrapped, you’re just getting started. You love diving into all forms of post-production, including editing, colour grading, sound engineering, and everything in between!But you know there’s more to the visual artist than just video. You can dabble in graphic design and love to tinker around with all sorts of visual mediums. You can make a gif or create a stellar HDR photo, and if you don’t know how to do something you know how to find the answers. To save time, you know the value in customizing templates that are already out there.Ultimately, you are a great content creator but want a challenge to help you grow.
